You are a Hubspot CRM Data Parser working for Anzu Partners. Anzu Partners is a venture capital investment firm that focuses on industrial and life science technology companies with the potential to transform their industry. Anzu manages a sourcing pipeline that consists of an email inbox where prospective deals are sent from Anzu employees, investors at other firms, and companies looking to raise money. Your job is to extract as much structured data as you can from data fetched from a hubspot crm apiThe structured data will be used to populate a payload that will be entered into the Hubspot API to populate deal information in the CRM. The expected entries are as follows, please note that some of the entries have specific options for you to choose from:
Deal Name (dealname),
Lead Owner (from hubspot_owner_id_details find First Name and Last Name and concat them together),
Support Owner (from team_member_1_details find First Name and Last Name and concat them together),
Broad Category (broad_category_updated),
Subcategory (subcategory),
Fund (fund),
Created Date (createdate)
Recommendation (You will provide this column as an array of three suggested subcategories)
Use the Deals in the data provided to infer every column.
For the Recommendation column please read the attachments, notes, and engagements in the deal data to suggest three subcategories that seem to best fit the information provided.
Please create new subcategories, you don't have to conform to the provided subcategories.

The current options for Broad Category are these:
Broad Category (options are Agricultural Technology, Consumer, Electronics, Energy & Clean Technology, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Manufacturing, Materials & Chemicals, Software & Advanced Computing, Transportation/ & Logistics, Other)

Additionally, you do not have to include any explanation text on why you chose the three subcategories. Simply returning a json object with the field specified is enough. And when you return the json you don't have to include the Broad Category in your recommendation, in other words. You don't have to append the Broad Category to the Sub category with hyphens like Life Sciences & Healthcare - Immunology, you can just provide the suggested sub category.

Hi Hunter,

This is a company that Denkenesh and I met with in Atlanta called DHX. They have a modified electric motor that is much smaller & lighter at equivalent horsepower than existing by modifying the heat exchanger. Currently have a lot of small product sales and some JDAs with OEMs for build-in electric motors (e.g. elevator/ThyssenKrup etc).

Just wanted to get your thoughts when you get a chance (no rush) since this is not an area I know too much about. I know you’ve looked at a few motor companies and was wondering if you had any kill shots here, or if you would be interested in learning more. No obligations here, we can treat as a cold inbound.

Logan Jackson

Deal info: {'id': '905779693', 'properties': {'broad_category_updated': None, 'createdate': '2019-07-29T23:38:38.750Z', 'dealname': 'immunoSCAPE', 'fund': 'Fund II', 'hs_lastmodifieddate': '2024-06-26T17:53:35.732Z', 'hs_object_id': '905779693', 'hubspot_owner_id': '30957569', 'pipeline': 'default', 'priority': '1-High', 'referral_type': None, 'subcategory': None, 'team_member_1': '30956536'}, 'createdAt': '2019-07-29T23:38:38.750Z', 'updatedAt': '2024-06-26T17:53:35.732Z', 'archived': False, 'notes': [{'id': '2905031833', 'properties': {'hs_attachment_ids': None, 'hs_createdate': '2019-07-29T23:40:24.233Z', 'hs_lastmodifieddate': '2021-09-30T13:10:42.461Z', 'hs_note_body': '

From DCM-

Interesting life sciences tools company, introduced to me by the Singapore government science and technology agency. One of their most promising start ups.
Singapore based, with the technology coming from a Stanford researcher.

Could be a play like Liquid Instruments, where the company re-incorporates over time to the US.

Company is raising a $7m Series A, and has a term sheet from an existing investor, Japanese VC, at a $32m pre. $3m of the round is available, and the round could be expanded.

Company is post revenue, scaling, with a immune profiling service in the market.

The proprietary technology is a multi-metal tagging of antibodies, which in turn are used to identify immune receptors n samples of cells that are being studied. Clients are big biopharma players.

I met the CEO for drinks last night. He is ex senior JnJ, ex Singapore military, Michigan MBA, solid guy.

I am working on executing an NDA and getting access to the data room.

', 'hs_object_id': '2905031833'}, 'createdAt': '2019-07-29T23:40:24.233Z', 'updatedAt': '2021-09-30T13:10:42.461Z', 'archived': False}, {'id': '2966345026', 'properties': {'hs_attachment_ids': None, 'hs_createdate': '2019-08-05T17:50:25.449Z', 'hs_lastmodifieddate': '2021-07-25T16:21:36.828Z', 'hs_note_body': '

JJK and DCM had call with Jay West to discuss on 8/5/2019. He holds the technical team in very high regard and is positive on there being a significant demand for the services that immunoSCAPE is offering. Key areas of risk that he suggested we dig into are the company's dependence on Fliudigm CyTOF, and why others can't make the metal tagged antibodies that immunoSCAPE has built their business on.

', 'hs_object_id': '2966345026'}, 'createdAt': '2019-08-05T17:50:25.449Z', 'updatedAt': '2021-07-25T16:21:36.828Z', 'archived': False}, {'id': '3632768281', 'properties': {'hs_attachment_ids': None, 'hs_createdate': '2019-10-15T15:56:10.900Z', 'hs_lastmodifieddate': '2021-07-17T15:00:24.225Z', 'hs_note_body': '

Term sheet has been signed with iS as of 10/8. We are commencing with diligence and have had follow-up meetings with Evan Newell at Fred Hutch, and several of their BD team members. Follow-up conversations with several immunologists are also being set up for later this week.

Through our IP network, we are also putting effort against improving the license terms for the company, and there is a planned renegotiation of iS's license within the next few weeks.

From WHS-

I reviewed the attached deck and it is indeed in our wheelhouse. I would suggest that we take a call with the CEO (via intro from Sam Bjork – feel free to reach out directly with me in cc). The company is in between Nanocellect (hardware for faster/better testing), Nirrin (analyte detection), and Banyan (focused on biomarkers). The company has $29M in prior capital (many strategics) with no sales (yet). At a minimum, the call will serve as a helpful benchmark for Nanocellect’s progress relative to similar tech in the market. I also think that a quick knockout could come on the round dynamic ($15M sought for Series D at valuation TBD). I would recommend that Greg or John take the call since the round dynamic (as opposed to the tech) is likely to be the major driver on our first-pass decision.

', 'hs_object_id': '2905016059'}, 'createdAt': '2019-07-30T00:02:24.499Z', 'updatedAt': '2021-09-30T13:10:42.832Z', 'archived': False}, {'id': '2945448012', 'properties': {'hs_attachment_ids': None, 'hs_createdate': '2019-08-02T15:31:03.594Z', 'hs_lastmodifieddate': '2021-09-30T13:10:42.908Z', 'hs_note_body': '

From JCH-

I’m not seeing anything particularly compelling based on Bryan’s note. Also, they’re competing against established incumbents like MSD and Quanterix that have large installed bases across the world. I’m not seeing how their tech is particularly game-changing in a way that disrupts the field. Also, the round is large making the likely pre-money too rich for my blood. This feels like Nanocellect 2.0 where the technology is not really a platform that can survive the binary scenario of hit or miss product sales. It’s a pass for me.
